did.unittitle: Edwin Wolf collection on the Polock family

bioghist.p: Edwin Wolf 2nd (1911-1991) was a librarian, bibliophile, author, historian, Franklin scholar, and civic leader. He was the Curator of the Library Company of Philadelphia from 1953 to 1955, and its Librarian from 1955 to 1984. Wolf's publications include A History of the Jews of Philadelphia from Colonial Times to the Age of Jackson, Rosenbach: A Biography, and The Library of James Logan of Philadelphia, 1674-1751. Hyman Polock (1786-1870) was a merchant of watches and jewelry in Philadelphia. He had three sons: Solomon (b. 1813), Barnett (1815-1849), and Lewis (1819-1851). All three of them traveled to the western United States. Solomon worked for a time in Galveston as a butcher. Barnett was a watchmaker who did business in Western Pennsylvania, as well as New Orleans, Galveston, and Alabama. Lewis went to San Francisco, where he sold clothing and textiles and worked as a tailor. He was also, for a short time, a gold prospector.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to Edwin Wolf's unpublished history of the Polock family of Philadelphia. Materials include Wolf's annotated typescript drafts and research correspondence and notes. There are also manuscripts letters and other documents of the Polock family. The majority of the letters are from Barnett and Lewis Polock to various members of the family.
